# isEnabledForSegment(at:)

**Instance Method**

Returns whether the indicated segment is enabled.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func isEnabledForSegment(at segment: Int) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **segment**: An index number identifying a segment in the control. It must be a number between 0 and the number of segments ([doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISegmentedControl/numberOfSegments]) minus 1; the segmented control pins values exceeding this upper range to the last segment.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the given segment is enabled and [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] if the segment is disabled. By default, segments are enabled.

## Managing segment behavior and appearance

- **isMomentary**: A Boolean value that determines whether segments in the segmented control show selected state.
- **setEnabled(_:forSegmentAt:)**: Enables the segment you specify.
- **setContentOffset(_:forSegmentAt:)**: Adjusts the offset for drawing the content (image or text) of the specified segment.
- **contentOffsetForSegment(at:)**: Returns the offset for drawing the content (image or text) of the segment you specify.
- **setWidth(_:forSegmentAt:)**: Sets the width of the segment at the index you specify.
- **widthForSegment(at:)**: Returns the width of the segment at the index you specify.
- **apportionsSegmentWidthsByContent**: Indicates whether the control attempts to adjust segment widths based on their content widths.
